If $AB$, $BC$, and $CA$ denote the sides of a right-angled triangle, then $$AB^2+BC^2=AC^2$$

The above theorem immediately implies the following corollary:

We can easily see that $$\sin^2{\theta}+\cos^2{\theta}=1$$
